exam.title: GT Reading 33 Section 3 - Notes in Australia

sections.title: GT Reading 33 Section 3 - Notes in Australia
sections.passage_md: Instead of 28 ............... a plastic polymer called BOPP is produced. ↓ 29 ............... is applied to the BOPP. ↓ A special area of the 30 .............. is left clear for 31 .............. . ↓ 32 ............... raises the printed elements on the BOPP ↓ Images on both sides are matched. ↓ Security and functionality are assessed by putting the notes next to a 33 ............ ↓ 34 ............ makes the polymer note shiny and longer-lasting.

questions.prompt_md: _______ _______ a plastic polymer called BOPP is produced.
_______ _______ raises the printed elements on the BOPP
_______ _______ makes the polymer note shiny and longer-lasting.Questions 35-39

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

35. Police Fund Notes were the first and only notes used in Australia.

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

36. The first notes issued by the Bank of New South Wales followed the British Imperial System.

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

37. The first series of Australian notes were released in 1910.

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

38. The construction of the note printing complex in Melbourne was due to economic progress in Australia.

TRUE if the statement agrees with the information, FALSE if it contradicts, NOT GIVEN if there is no information on this.

39. Illustrations on the first Australian polymer note featured Australia’s bi-centenary. Question 40 Choose the correct question, A-E. Write the correct letter in box 40 on your answer sheet. Which of the following is the most suitable title for this reading passage? A. Early Australian money B. The economy of Australia C. New polymer notes for Australia D. Changes in Australian money E. The future of Australian money
